ancestors.content:
🧵Here's two images of a street in #cardiff Wales.

During the heatwave of 2023 we commissioned Thermal imaging Ltd to record the temperature within the trees shade, & from the surrounding area.

The results directly illustrated the cooling effect of that single urban tree.

1📸Thermal Image
2📸Photo

Trees, save lives & money!

https://woodlandtrust.org.uk/protecting-trees-and-woods/benefits-of-urban-trees/tree-equity/

#TreeEquity

#trees #coedcadw #climatechange #climatecrisis #climate #wales #uk - #woodlandtrust #climatediary

account.note: Croeso! We are Woodland Trust in Wales. We plant, we protect and we restore native woods and trees to combat climate change and to build a greener future.

media_attachments.description:
Thermal image of a street in Adamsdown, Cardiff, in a position where there's a single street tree. 

The image is annotated with spot temperatures. The exposed tarmac records 41.9 Degrees C at the highest, and the lowest in the tree shade on the road records 22.2 Degrees C
This is the corresponding photo, with the same temperature transferred on to the photo, in the same locations.

descendants.content:
🧵 Aneurin Bevan Statue #Cardiff an economic centre.

Where there's trees you will see significant heat reduction, making the area more comfortable, & desirable to use.

Surfaces exposed to direct sun, soak heat up, this increases day & night temperatures, it's called the #UrbanHeatIsland Effect.

They also reduce the costs of air conditioning, especially combined with living walls, and roofs.

https://www.woodlandtrust.org.uk/protecting-trees-and-woods/benefits-of-urban-trees/

#trees #climate #climatechange #climatecrisis #wales #uk

Aneurin Bevan Statue Cardiff an economic centre.

The thermal image is annotated with spot temperatures. The exposed paving records 44.3 Degrees C at the highest, and within the tree shade on the same paving 25.2 Degrees C.

descendants.content:
🧵 Below are the temperatures recorded in the same heat wave, on the same day at #Cardiff Castle.

Again where there's tree shade you'll see a temperature difference of up to 2O degrees!

Trees make tourist hot spots more desirable to use, whilst improving the economics of the venue.

Much like farm livestock, you'll also see many a tourist seeking the cooling shade of trees.

#treeequity #trees #climate #climatechange #climatecrisis #climateaction #tourism #wales #uk

media_attachments.description:
Thermal image of a single tree within Cardiff Castle. A tourist hot spot.

The image is annotated with spot temperatures. The exposed hard surfaces records 43.0 Degrees C at the highest, and the lowest in the tree shade 23.1 Degrees C.
This is the corresponding photo, with the same temperatures transferred on to the photo, in the same locations.

descendants.content:
🧵 finally, Bute Park, Cardiff Central. We symbolically pictured the wooden mole sculpture there!

Great tree cover within our urban parks not only adds to the cooling effect of a city, & enables greater wellbeing, but they also provide shade, shelter & habitat for urban wildlife. We can forget, like us, #nature can really suffer in extreme heat!

#TreeEquity - life deserves equitable access to trees, & the health & wellbeing they provide.

https://www.woodlandtrust.org.uk/protecting-trees-and-woods/benefits-of-urban-trees/tree-equity/

#trees #EU #UK #Wales

🧵END

media_attachments.description:
Thermal image of Bute Park - Cardiff Central, we symbolically pictured the wooden mole sculpture there.   

The image is annotated with spot temperatures. The exposed mound around the wooded mole reads a whooping 59.2 Degrees C at the highest, and the lowest in the tree shade  21 Degrees C
This is the corresponding photo, with the same temperature transferred on to the photo, in the same locations.

descendants.content: @CoedCadw We wish the city's council understood the very real value of mature urban trees and invested in their care and protection, instead of leaving us with the perception that a strategy of replacing them with saplings represents genuine like-for-like.

account.note:
Lovers of fine vegetarian food. If we're not cooking or eating it, we're reading, talking or writing about it. We wear our food with pride!

Cardiff, Wales, UK, Europe

descendants.content: @CoedCadw also in winter trees protect the area from strong winds. A single tree doesn't do much but multiple trees and hedges in an area make it much more liveable - they protect an area 5 to 10 times the height of the vegetation and make it much more likely that people will want to stop, chat, shop, ...

account.note: Not a lot to say about myself. Worked as GP in valleys, then public health something to do with data of health events. Ignored mainly, you're advised to do the same. Meanwhile if you fancy seeing what I'm thinking this is quite a good place happy to be corrected as I don't know as much as I think I do. It's a common male fault. 🤣
